page.title: 09CHANGES AT CASTLE BYTHAM.
page.content: Fifteen years is not a long time in historical terms but even so there have been noticeable changes during that time.In the 1960's the majority of the children's parents worked in the village.The two main areas of employment were the surrounding farms and the limestone quarry situated near the centre of the village.Increased mechanisation meant fewer jobs were available locally and gradually the old order of life changed.Previously several generations of a family would pass through the school register.This now began to stop as local people moved away to find work.New families moved into the village_in most cases their places of work were many miles away.The car now linked the village firmly with the wider world.It still remains,however,a peaceful,pleasant place.
